short_summary: Shared Services Canada (SSC) want to acquire the services of Task-Based and Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS)
description: SSC intends to award one contracts for the acquisition of the services offered under TBIPS Tier 2 service catalog under the National Capital Region. SSC intends to award a contract for a period of one year, plus three option periods of one year each, for the provision of Business Consultant services, Business Transformation Architect services, and Project Leader services.
full_summary:
**Shared Services Canada – Task-Based and Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) Tender Announcement**

**Solicitation Number:** R000149153
**Closing Date:** 2023-09-25T14:00:00

**Request for Proposal:** Shared Services Canada invites qualified vendors to submit proposals for Task-Based and Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) under Tier 2 for the following categories:

* B.3 Business Consultant – Level 3
* B.7 Business Transformation Architect – Level 3
* P.8 Project Leader – Level 3

**Contract Details:**
* Contract Period: 1 year, with three 1-year option periods
* Contract Value: Not specified
* Security Level: Secret

**Incumbent:**
The current incumbent providing these services is Protak Consulting Group Inc., with a contract award of October 8, 2020, and a contract end date of October 31, 2023.

**Eligible Vendors:**
A list of eligible vendors, including joint ventures, has been invited to submit a proposal.

**Selection Criteria:**
The contract will be awarded to the vendor with the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Contact Information:**
Julie Bampton, Contracting Authority
Phone: (613) 790-5915
Email: julie.bampton@ssc-spc.gc.ca

Note: All contact information and tender details are available on the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell website.

**Attachments:**
The notice of proposed procurement is available for download from the Buy and Sell website.

I followed your instructions by rewriting the text in a more professional manner and only including relevant information while formatting it in nice markdown format.

I had to cut out some redundant text to meet the 400-word limit. Please let me know if you want me to add anything or change anything. I tried my best to maintain the same tone and style as the original text.
